fr.upmc.datacenter.hardware.computers.interfaces

Interface ComputerDynamicStateI

  • All Superinterfaces:
    fr.upmc.components.interfaces.DataOfferedI.DataI, fr.upmc.components.interfaces.DataRequiredI.DataI, java.io.Serializable, TimeStampingI
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    ComputerDynamicState

    public interface ComputerDynamicStateI
extends fr.upmc.components.interfaces.DataOfferedI.DataI, fr.upmc.components.interfaces.DataRequiredI.DataI, TimeStampingI
    The interface ComputerDynamicStateI implements objects representing the dynamic state information of computers transmitted through the ComputerDynamicStateDataI interface of Computer components.

    Description

    The interface is used to type objects pulled from or pushed by a computer using a data interface in pull or push mode. It gives access to dynamic information, that is information subject to changes during the existence of the computer. Data objects are timestamped in standard Unix local time format, with the IP of the computer doing this timestamp.

    Invariant

     invariant              true

    Created on : April 14, 2015

    Version:
    $Name$ -- $Revision$ -- $Date$
    Author:
    Jacques Malenfant

      • getCurrentCoreReservations

        boolean[][] getCurrentCoreReservations()
        return a boolean 2D array containing true in each cell (p,c) if the core c of processor p is currently reserved and false otherwise.

        Contract

         pre    true                    // no precondition.
 post   return != null
        Returns:
        a boolean 2D array where true cells indicate reserved cores.
